channel.title: The best Anti-Logout EVUR :o

item.title: The best Anti-Logout EVUR :o
item.dc:creator: @Westside_Rep Westside Rep
item.description:
@Westside_Rep wrote:

[code]//hold f9 to quit
Program antilogout;
var mousex,mousey,OldMousex,OldMousey,wtfeggs :integer;

Begin
ActivateClient;
GetMousePos(Mousex,Mousey);
OldMousex:=Mousex;
OldMouseY:=MouseY;
wtfeggs:=0
Repeat
Repeat
Sleep(6000);
GetMousePos(MouseX,MouseY);
If(MouseX=OldMouseX) Or (MouseY=OldMouseY)Then WtfEggs:=WtfEggs+1
If(Not(MouseX=OldMouseX)) Or (Not(MouseY=OldMouseY))Then
Begin
WtfEggs:=0
OldMousex:=MouseX;
OldMouseY:=MouseY;
End;
Sleep(100+random(23));
Until(WtfEggs=10) Or (IsFKeyDown(9))
Status(‘No Movement Detected, Moving Mouse’)
Sleep(500+random(9));
MoveMouseSmooth(50+Random(300),50+Random(300));
Sleep(500+Random(40));
Status(‘Mouse Moved.’);
Until(IsFKeyDown(9))
Writeln(‘YAY YOU WON!!!’);
WriteLn(‘Why Must you Leave now? I’‘ve been having fun.’);
End.
[/code]

I know All It does is move the mouse, But thats all it needs to do. I was messing around with cheat engne and I found the value that says how long youve been af(k,m) And I moved the mouse onto rs, and it went to 0 again, so, you’ll never d/c and you’ll learn something new ^^

It wont move the mouse after every 60 seconds, It checks to see if you moved your mouse every 6 seconds, And checks 10 times a minute (obviously).

And Don’t Complain that I used MoveMouseSmooth… It’s not like they’ll even care about someone who is supposedly using a macro that doesnt even “touch” A button.

This Took Me HOURS to make (jk, it was like 5 minutes) so give me feedback.

[size=1pt]psst, I’ll give you candy If you give me feedback[/size]
